frameDefinitions: A Speaker uses language to affirm or deny the truth of a Message to some Addressee.
A Supplier gives a Theme to a Recipient to fulfill a need or purpose (Imposed_purpose) of the Recipient.
A Signatory signs an Agreement document, thereby taking on a commitment encoded in the Agreement.  '.
A physical Exerter, Action, or Force exerts energy at a level specified by the target.
In this frame, an Authority allows a Protagonist to know (in some way) that they may or may not engage in an Action.
A Ratifier responds to a Proposal constructed by another party to make it binding over the Ratifier's jurisdiction or constituency.
frameExamples: She <t>affirmed</t> her loyalty to the cause.
Habituating the ground nesting chimp groups is done by <t>provisioning</t> them with sugar cane. CNI INI
. During this time, 84 countries (including the United States) <t>signed</t> the Protocol.
Although an <t>energetic</t> and able warrior, Charlemagne tended to direct battles rather than fight in person.
The police officer <t>forbid</t> me from turning around .
The <t>ratification</t> of the Kyoto protocol has been a long, hard slog.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity affirming or denying the truth of the <fen>Message</fen> (this can be spoken or written). It is normally expressed as the External Argument of the predicative uses of the target word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> identifies the content whose truth the <fen>Speaker</fen> is affirming or denying. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is rarely mentioned in constructions with verbal targets, and is much more common with nominal targets, where it is usually expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'of' or about'.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
<fen>Place</fen> specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that is given to the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The <fen>Recipient</fen>'s intended purpose for the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The signatory of the <fen>Agreement</fen>.
The entity signifying the identity of the <fen>Signatory</fen>, resulting from the act of writing on the <fen>Agreement</fen> document.
The document which encodes the commitment of the <fen>Signatory</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which signature is given.
The place where the signing occurs.
The <fen>Action</fen> that exerts an energy of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Exerter</fen> which exerts an energy of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Force</fen> that exerts an energy of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> exerts an energy.
The location where the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> exerts its energy.
The <fen>Authority</fen> orders the <fen>Protagonist</fen> to not engage in a particular <fen>Action</fen>.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> wants to engage in an <fen>Action</fen>, but is ordered not to by the <fen>Authority</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is what the <fen>Protagonist</fen> seeks to do, but is ordered not to.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the denying of permission occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the denial of permission occurs.

The individual or body that confirms a Proposal negotiated or created by another party, causing it to become binding in a jurisdiction represented by the <fen>Ratifier</fen>.  In the case of direct democratic ratification, the jurisdiction and the <fen>Ratifier</fen> are the same.
The idea or course of action proposed by another individual or body which the <fen>Ratifier</fen> endorses and makes binding.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Ratifier</fen> makes the <fen>Proposal</fen> binding.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Ratifier</fen> ratifies the <fen>Proposal</fen>.
listRoleExamples: No one believed <fex>Evelyn</fex>'s affirmation that she could speak to ghosts.
They refute the criticisms <fex>that they are only interested in power and money</fex>.
I approve of <fex>your</fex> having supplied him with a file of soldiers.
VESID also supplied <fex>him</fex> with an all zone bus pass to help him travel to interviews.

Cromwell merged men from multiple regiments into a single one and provisioned
them <fex>with red uniforms</fex> to replace their former regiment colors.
God gave them the promise of victory and equipped them <fex>for the battle</fex>.
In Breidbach, water tankers were <fex>yesterday</fex> supplied to the community as the main water supply pipe had been washed away.

The Harpley was launched in Launceston on the 2nd February, 1847, and with the exception
of her chain cables, was <fex>there</fex> supplied with all her materials and stores.
The Attorney General seemingly never put his <fex>signature</fex> on the agreement.
I signed <fex>the contract</fex> and now the dealership claims they made a mistake, quoted the price too low and now I have to pay them more money.
He was given a vigorous <fex>slap</fex> on the ear for his behavior.
More deadly and painful is the chemical weaponry of the camouflaged but lethargic <fex>stonefish</fex>.
They were trying to harness some of the lightening's intense <fex>power</fex>.
Charlie's workout was intense even <fex>first thing in the morning</fex>.
Because of the added space, our ultimate frisbee game was more vigorous <fex>in Golden Gate Park</fex>.
If <fex>we</fex> ratify Management 's plan , we 'll have to take a drug test every week !
President Aleksander Kwasniewski ratified <fex>protocols to the Europol Convention</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China
